channel.title: maGaming RSS Feed - remapradio.com
channel.description: A cleaned-up version of the original gaming feed for remapradio.com

item.title: This Week at Remap
item.content:encoded:
Goodbye, football! You were wonderful to me this year. I'd also like to congratulate my nine-year-old for once again calling the coin flip in the Super Bowl again—she's on a three-year streak at the moment. We put $50 on the coin flip every year, with me joking about how it'll pay for her college. The funny part is a week ago, we set her up with a debit card, after a trip to the mall resulted in two stores that would not let her pay with cash. The app lets us reward her with money for doing chores—and we no longer have to stress about where she put her wallet. Anyway, when she won the coin toss, she turned to me and said: "hey, how much of that do I get?"

I promptly opened my phone and sent her $25. Damn shark!

-pk, who mostly found the Super Bowl pretty boring

  • PODCAST: Remap Interviews Edmund McMillen – Between the success of Super Meat Boy and Binding of Isaac, you might assume designer Edmund McMillen is feeling confident going into the release of his latest game, the tactics-focused Mewgenics.
  • ARTICLE: "Edmund McMillen Is Still Nervous About Releasing a Video Game" by Patrick Klepek – McMillen has had about as critically and commercially successful a career as one could hope for. Yet insecurities come back with each release.
  • PODCAST: Sports! – Well, we couldn't help ourselves. It would be impossible to avoid gloating about the New England Patriots completely eating shit.
  • STREAM: Baby Steps – I will never get tired of playing this video game.
  • STREAM: The Sims – The building of a Remap hype house continues with Chia, Danika, and Janet.
  • PODCAST: Remap Radio – A return to the regular format, plus we'll reveal the final games on Danika's game of the year list.
  • STREAM: Motorsport Manager – There are rumors abound that Rob wants Chia to play the mini-games, so Rob can prove they're a pain in the ass.
  • ARTICLE: Letter Series – Topic TBD!

If you have any support issues, send details to support@remapradio.com

Patrick Klepek (he/him) is an editor at Remap. In another life, he worked on horror movie sets, but instead, he also runs Crossplay, a newsletter about parenting and video games. You can follow him on Twitter, Threads, Mastodon, and Bluesky.
